intro: Forasaccus commutatus, commonly known as the commutate forasaccus, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
